clinical_study.brief_title: Intervention for Caregivers of Patients Who Have Recently Undergone HSCT
clinical_study.official_title: A Pilot Study to Evaluate the Feasibility of an Intervention for Caregivers of Patients Who Have Recently Undergone HSCT

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find out if providing support to caregivers of patients who have recently had a HSCT is possible and helpful.

detailed_description.textblock: This study will test the feasibility, acceptability, usability, satisfaction and preliminary efficacy of a behavioral (psychoeducation) intervention. All participants will receive the standard post-hospital HSCT information for patient follow-up care as provided by the patient's oncologist. In addition, the all participants will receive 4 individual sessions with an interventionist.

primary_outcome.description: Caregiver Acceptability as measured by Acceptability Scale scores. Overall score ranging from 6-30. According to prior research, a score of 80% of higher (total score of 24 or higher) is considered acceptable for use.

Caregiver Usability as measured by the System Usability Scale. This is a 10 item scale scored on a 5 point Likert scale with total summed scores ranging from 0-50. Total scores are multiplied by 2 to produce an overall score ranging from 0-100 with scores > 68 considered to be above average usability

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of each intervention session and end of study evaluation, up to 2 months
primary_outcome.description: Caregiver Satisfaction scores as measured by Likert Scale. After completing each module, they will be sent via REDCap a single item evaluation scale (0 -10; 0=Not at all satisfied; 10=Highly satisfied). Scores >7 will be considered acceptable. Mean and standard deviation will be reported.

primary_outcome.measure: Percent of enrollment of eligible participants
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility as measured by percent of enrollment of eligible participants
Feasibility as measured by intervention completion
Feasibility as measured by percent of participants retained in full study (aim: 90% retention at the end of the 2-month intervention)

primary_outcome.measure: Average time to recruit dyads in months
primary_outcome.description: Feasibility as measured by time to identify and recruit dyads in months (benchmark 3 months)
Feasibility as measured by completion of data collection across study timepoints

secondary_outcome.description: Caregiver Distress as measured by NCCN Distress Thermometer scores
Caregiver Anxiety as measured by PROMISR Short Form v1.0 - Anxiety scores. Scores range from 1 to 5, with higher scores indicating worse anxiety
Caregiver Health Related Quality of Life as measured by PROMISRv.1.2-GlobalHealth scores. HRQOL scores range from 1 to 5, with higher scores indicating better outcomes

arm_group.description: All participants will receive receive 4 individual sessions with an interventionist in addition to the standard post-hospital HSCT information for patient follow-up care as provided by the patient's oncologist

intervention.description: Participant will be sent a baseline survey, and will then be contacted by the interventionist to complete 4 sessions, which feature the following areas: Session 1: Identifying CG Needs for Information & Support, Communication with Healthcare Team Session 2: Communication with Patient and Family Session 3: Self-care: Emotional & Spiritual Needs, Self-care: Physical Needs Session 4: Re-Assessing Needs, Planning for the future

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- An adult family or friend of a patient who has been discharged from the hospital in the past 1-2 weeks after receiving HSCT
- Identifies himself/herself as the caregiver who will be responsible for the patient's care post-HSCT
- Has English as their primary language
Exclusion Criteria:
-Not meeting inclusion criteria

patient_data.ipd_description: This is a pilot study to only test the intervention so the data would not be useful to participants until a larger study (with control and intervention groups) is completed in the future
